metadata.title: CVE-2020-15673 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 80 andFirefox ESR 78.2. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort some of these could have beenexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 81,Thunderbird < 78.3, and Firefox ESR < 78.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15673` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
